titleStmt.title: A treatise of treasons against Q. Elizabeth, and the croune of England diuided into two partes: whereof, the first parte answereth certaine treasons pretended, that neuer were intended: and the second, discouereth greater treasons committed, that are by few perceiued: as more largely appeareth in the page folowing.
titleStmt.author: Leslie, John, 1527-1596, attributed name.

publicationStmt.date: in the moneth of Ianuarie, and in the yeare of our Lord. M.D.LXXII. [1572]

notesStmt.note: The first part is a reply to "Salutem in Christo" by R.G.; the second attacks Francis Bacon and William Cecil, Baron Burghley.
Printer's name and place of publication from STC.
Running title reads: Treasons against Q.E. and the Crowne of England.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
